532 Gallery Jaeckel
PATRICK NEAL:
Sunflowers and Cotton, 2024
Watercolor on paper, mounted on panel
91.44 × 91.44 × 5 cm
PURCHASE / INQUIRE
$4500
Shipping quote on request. Local pickup available.
About the artwork:

Sunflowers and cotton intermingle in teeming arrangement, using en plein air observation to highlight hovering perspectives and bodily encounters with everyday flora.

About the artist:

Patrick Neal’s watercolor paintings are lush and teeming with life, depicting still lifes and landscapes from studio props, parks, and gardens. Viewed from bird’s-eye perspectives, his works activate edge-to-edge surfaces, blending impressionistic observation with abstraction to evoke sensual qualities and bodily discovery.

Patrick Neal was born in 1966 in Troy, NY, and is based in New York and Queens. He holds an MFA from Yale University and attended Yale Norfolk School of Art, the New York Studio School, and Skowhegan.

Neal has had solo exhibitions throughout New York. He has participated in recent group exhibitions supported by his 2018 NYFA Artist Fellow in Painting and Queens Art Fund New Work Grant, with works in private and public collections.

View Full Artist Profile
